content: To advance to the Elite Eight for the second time in three years, the Mountaineers and Carter will have to take down no. 1 seed Gonzaga. Carter will be in charge of containing the Bulldogs backcourt of Jordan Matthews (10.7 points, 39.2 percent from 3 on 5.4 attempts) and Nigel Williams-Goss (16.7 points, 4.7 assists, 5.8 rebounds). But these are the games Carter lives for; he probably started devising ways to get under Williams-Goss’s skin as soon as West Virginia beat Notre Dame.
